data.chText: 最后的；最末的；末尾的
data.enText: happening or coming after all other similar things or people

data.chText: 我们赶上了回家的末班公共汽车。
data.enText: We caught the last bus home.

data.chText: 是左边尽头那栋房子。
data.enText: It's the last house on the left.

data.chText: 她是最后到的。
data.enText: She was last to arrive.

data.chText: 最近的；上一个的
data.enText: most recent

data.chText: 昨晚；上个星期二 / 月；刚过去的夏季；去年
data.enText: last night/Tuesday/month/summer/year

data.chText: 她最近出版的书
data.enText: her last book

data.chText: 刚讲的这一点是关键的。
data.enText: This last point is crucial.

data.chText: 我上次见到他是在五月份。
data.enText: The last time I saw him was in May.

data.chText: 仅剩下的；最终的
data.enText: only remaining

data.chText: 这是我们最后的一瓶水了。
data.enText: This is our last bottle of water.

data.chText: 他知道这是他获胜的最后机会。
data.enText: He knew this was his last hope of winning.

data.chText: （强调）最不可能的，最不适当的
data.enText: used to emphasize that sb/sth is the least likely or suitable

data.chText: 她最不需要的就是更多的工作。
data.enText: The last thing she needed was more work.

data.chText: 我要是有什么秘密，告诉谁也不能告诉他。
data.enText: He's the last person I'd trust with a secret.
be on your/its last legs

data.chText: 濒临死亡；奄奄一息；行将就木；快不能用了
data.enText: to be going to die or stop functioning very soon; to be very weak or in bad condition
the day, week, month, etc. before last

data.chText: 前天；上上星期；上上月；两天（或两周等）以前
data.enText: the day, week, etc. just before the most recent one; two days, weeks, etc. ago

data.chText: 我已有两个夏天没见过他了。
data.enText: I haven't seen him since the summer before last.
every last…

data.chText: （某群体中的）每一个，全部
data.enText: every person or thing in a group

data.chText: 我们把所有的钱都花在房子上了。
data.enText: We spent every last penny we had on the house.
have the last laugh

data.chText: （在本未指望时）笑在最后，取得最后胜利
data.enText: to be successful when you were not expected to be, making your opponents look stupid
in the last resort

data.chText: 作为最后的一招
data.enText: when there are no other possible courses of action

data.chText: 顶多我们走回家就是了。
data.enText: In the last resort we can always walk home.
your/the last gasp

data.chText: 奄奄一息；苟延残喘；临终；垂死
data.enText: the point at which you/sth can no longer continue living, fighting, existing, etc.
the last minute/moment

data.chText: （重大事情前的）最后一刻，紧要关头
data.enText: the latest possible time before an important event

data.chText: 事到临头他们却改变了计划。
data.enText: They changed the plans at the last minute.

data.chText: 别等到最后一刻才来作决定。
data.enText: Don't leave your decision to the last moment.
a/your last resort

data.chText: 最后可依赖的人（或事物）
data.enText: the person or thing you rely on when everything else has failed

data.chText: 其他人我都试过了，现在就靠你了。
data.enText: I've tried everyone else and now you're my last resort.
the last word (in sth)

data.chText: 最新（或时髦、先进等）的事物
data.enText: the most recent, fashionable, advanced, etc. thing

data.chText: 这些房间最为豪华。
data.enText: These apartments are the last word in luxury.
in the final/last analysis

data.chText: 归根结底；总之
data.enText: used to say what is most important after everything has been discussed, or considered

data.chText: 归根结底，这是个人的选择。
data.enText: In the final analysis, it's a matter of personal choice.
his/her last/dying breath

data.chText: 最后一口气；临终；临死
data.enText: the last moment of a person's life
famous last words

data.chText: 吹牛，胡扯（表示某人盲目乐观）
data.enText: people sometimes say Famous last words! when they think sb is being too confident about sth that is going to happen

data.chText: “一切都在掌握之中。”“净吹牛！”
data.enText: ‘Everything's under control.’ ‘Famous last words!’

data.chText: 这个短语原指名人临终遗言语录选编。
data.enText: This phrase refers to a collection of quotations of the dying words of famous people.
at long last

data.chText: 最后；终于
data.enText: after a long time

data.chText: 他的祷告终于应验了。
data.enText: At long last his prayers had been answered.
to a man
to the last man

data.chText: 一致；毫无例外
data.enText: used to emphasize that sth is true of all the people being described

data.chText: 他们异口同声地回答：“是。”
data.enText: They answered ‘Yes,’ to a man.

data.chText: 他们无一例外全部被歼。
data.enText: They were all destroyed, to the last man.
the last/final straw
the straw that breaks the camel's back

data.chText: 压垮骆驼的最后一根稻草；终于使人不堪忍受的最后一件事（或因素等）
data.enText: the last in a series of bad events, etc. that makes it impossible for you to accept a situation any longer
first/last thing

data.chText: 一早 / 晚上最后（要做的事）
data.enText: early in the morning/late in the evening

data.chText: 星期一一早这个报告就得放在我的办公桌上。
data.enText: I need the report on my desk first thing Monday morning.
a week yesterday, last Monday, etc.

data.chText: 一个星期前的昨天（或星期一等）
data.enText: seven days before the day that you mention

data.chText: 她在一个星期前的昨天就开始工作了。
data.enText: She started work a week yesterday.

data.chText: 最后；最终；终结
data.enText: after anyone or anything else; at the end

data.chText: 这次赛跑他得了最后一名。
data.enText: He came last in the race.

data.chText: 他们来得比谁都晚。
data.enText: They arrived last of all.

data.chText: 最新；最近；上一次
data.enText: most recently

data.chText: 你最近什么时候见过他？
data.enText: When did you see him last?

data.chText: 我上一次是两年前在纽约见到他的。
data.enText: I saw him last/I last saw him in New York two years ago.

data.chText: 他们上一次获得奖杯是在2002年。
data.enText: They last won the cup in 2002.
last but not least

data.chText: （提及最后的人或事物时说）最后但同样重要的
data.enText: used when mentioning the last person or thing of a group, in order to say that they are not less important than the others

data.chText: 最后但同样重要的是，我要感谢所有的餐饮工作人员。
data.enText: Last but not least, I'd like to thank all the catering staff.
last in, first out

data.chText: （形容裁员等情况）最后雇用的人最先被解雇，后来者先走
data.enText: used, for example in a situation when people are losing their jobs, to say that the last people to be employed will be the first to go
first and last

data.chText: 从各方面看；完全地
data.enText: in every way that is important; completely

data.chText: 她认为她自己是一个不折不扣的音乐家。
data.enText: She regarded herself, first and last, as a musician.
he who laughs last laughs longest

data.chText: 别高兴得太早
data.enText: used to tell sb not to be too proud of their present success; in the end another person may be more successful
the last

data.chText: 最后来的人（或发生的事）
data.enText: the person or thing that comes or happens after all other similar people or things

data.chText: 对不起，我来晚了，我是最后到的人吗？
data.enText: Sorry I'm late─am I the last?

data.chText: 他们是最后到达的人。
data.enText: They were the last to arrive.

data.chText: 仅剩下的部分（或事项）
data.enText: the only remaining part or items of sth

data.chText: 这是我们最后剩下的几个苹果。
data.enText: These are the last of our apples.
at (long) last

data.chText: （经过长时间的延误或努力等之后）终于，最终
data.enText: after much delay, effort, etc.; in the end

data.chText: 我们终于到家了！
data.enText: At last we're home!

data.chText: 支票终于到了。
data.enText: At long last the cheque arrived.
hear/see the last of sb/sth

data.chText: 最后一次听见（或看见）
data.enText: to hear/see sb/sth for the last time

data.chText: 那是我最后一次见到她。
data.enText: That was the last I ever saw of her.

data.chText: 遗憾的是，我认为这件事还没有了结。
data.enText: Unfortunately, I don't think we've heard the last of this affair.
the last I heard

data.chText: （提供最新消息时说）我听到的最新消息
data.enText: used to give the most recent news you have about sb/sth

data.chText: 我听到的最新消息是他还在汽车修理厂工作。
data.enText: The last I heard he was still working at the garage.
next/second to last
last but one

data.chText: 倒数第二
data.enText: the one before the last one

data.chText: 她得了倒数第二。
data.enText: She finished second to last.
to/till the last

data.chText: 直到最后一刻；（尤指）直至死亡
data.enText: until the last possible moment, especially until death

data.chText: 他至死都坚决辩称自己无罪。
data.enText: He died protesting his innocence to the last.
breathe your last

data.chText: 气绝（身亡）；断气
data.enText: to die
from first to last

data.chText: 从头至尾；自始至终
data.enText: from beginning to end; during the whole time

data.chText: 这是个精彩的演出，自始至终都扣人心弦。
data.enText: It's a fine performance that commands attention from first to last.

data.chText: 持续；继续；延续

before.enText: not used in the progressive tenses

data.enText: to continue for a particular period of time

data.chText: 会议只开了几分钟。
data.enText: The meeting only lasted (for) a few minutes.

data.chText: 每场比赛约一小时。
data.enText: Each game lasts about an hour.

data.chText: 那出戏要演多长时间？
data.enText: How long does the play last?

data.chText: 继续存在；持续起作用；持久
data.enText: to continue to exist or to function well

data.chText: 这种天气持续不了多久。
data.enText: This weather won't last.

data.chText: 现在他正加紧努力，我希望他能坚持下去。
data.enText: He's making a big effort now, and I hope it lasts.

data.chText: 你这双鞋应该能穿到明年。
data.enText: These shoes should last you till next year.

data.chText: （在困境等中）坚持下去；超越（困境等）
data.enText: to survive sth or manage to stay in the same situation, despite difficulties

data.chText: 她那份工作干不了多久。
data.enText: She won't last long in that job.

data.chText: 你能支撑到有人来帮我吗？
data.enText: Can you last (out) until I can get help?

data.chText: 医生都说她很可能活不过今晚。
data.enText: Doctors say that she probably won't last out the night (= she will probably die before the morning) .

data.chText: 他开赛后不久就受了伤，没法坚持到底。
data.enText: He was injured early on and didn't last the match.

data.chText: 够用，足够维持（尤指某段时间）
data.enText: to be enough for sb to use, especially for a particular period of time

data.chText: 咖啡够喝到下周吗？
data.enText: Will the coffee last out till next week?

data.chText: 我们的食物足够维持三天。
data.enText: We've got enough food to last us (for) three days.

data.chText: 鞋楦
data.enText: a block of wood or metal shaped like a foot, used in making and repairing shoes

data.chText: last和take均表示某事持续的时间。
data.enText: Last and take are both used to talk about the length of time that something continues.

data.chText: last表示某事持续的时间：
data.enText: Last is used to talk about the length of time that an event continues.

data.chText: 你看这暴风雨会持续多久？
data.enText: How long do you think this storm will last?

data.chText: 这部电影长两个多小时。
data.enText: The movie lasted over two hours.

data.chText: last并非总需要与表示时间的词语连用：
data.enText: Last does not always need an expression of time.

data.chText: 他不会烦恼多久。
data.enText: His annoyance won’t last.

data.chText: last亦可表示够用、足够维持：
data.enText: Last is also used to say that you have enough of something.

data.chText: 我们的钱不足以维持到下个月。
data.enText: We don’t have enough money to last until next month.

data.chText: take表示到某地或做某事需要的时间，必须与表示时间的词语连用：
data.enText: Take is used to talk about the amount of time you need in order to go somewhere or do something. It must be used with an expression of time.

data.chText: （我）下班回家至少得花一个小时。
data.enText: It takes (me) at least an hour to get home from work.

data.chText: 此次航班将飞行多长时间？
data.enText: How long will the flight take?

data.chText: 好半天水才开了。
data.enText: The water took ages to boil.

word_means: 最不可能的，最不适当的

means: （强调）最不可能的，最不适当的
最后来的人(或发生的事)
够用，足够维持（尤指某段时间）

ex.chText: 下个月要进行期末考试。
ex.enText: The final examination will take place next month.

ex.chText: 我喜欢她的巴黎四部曲中的最后一部。
ex.enText: I like the final installment of her Paris tetralogy.

synonyms.bx: 只作定语，指一系列行动、事件、故事情节等中最后的。

ex.chText: 哪个国家是这场谈判的最后赢家？
ex.enText: Which country was the eventual winner of the negotiation?

ex.chText: 最终结果和他预测的一模一样。
ex.enText: The eventual outcome was exactly the same as he had predicted.

synonyms.bx: 只作定语，指经过很长时间或很多事情之后终于发生的。

ex.chText: 这本杂志的最后一页被撕掉了。
ex.enText: The last page of the magazine was torn out.

ex.chText: 她在12月的最后一个星期收到了礼物。
ex.enText: She received the gift in the last week of December.

ex.chText: 这位老妇人是部落中最后一位会讲那种语言的人。
ex.enText: This elderly lady is the last person who can speak that language in her tribe.
She was last to arrive home.

synonyms.bx: 指最后发生或存在的，强调再无后续的。

ex.chText: 该问题在那10年的大部分时间里一直存在。
ex.enText: This problem persisted for much of the decade.

ex.chText: 由于疼痛持续不减，那位老人不得不联系自己的医生。
ex.enText: The old man has to contact his doctor as the pain persists.

synonyms.bx: 多指不好的情况持续存在。

ex.enText: Home prices continued to fall during April.

ex.chText: 生完孩子之后她将继续研究工作。
ex.enText: She will continue her research after the birth of her baby.

synonyms.bx: 既可指没有间断地持续发生、存在或进行，又可指中断后再继续。

ex.chText: 他们的友谊保持了很多年。
ex.enText: Their friendship endured over many years.

ex.chText: 她认为他的事业将会持续成功。
ex.enText: She thinks that his career is a success that will endure.

ex.chText: 寒冷的天气持续了整个2月。
ex.enText: The cold weather lasted for the whole month of February.

ex.chText: 一条好的牛仔裤可以穿10年。
ex.enText: A pair of good jeans will last you ten years.

synonyms.bx: 指持续一段时间；也指长时间存在、有效或保持良好的状态。

data.enText: be on your/its last legs

data.chText: 濒临死亡；奄奄一息；行将就木；快不能用了
data.enText: to be going to die or stop functioning very soon; to be very weak or in bad condition
the day, week, month, etc. before last

data.chText: 前天；上上星期；上上月；两天（或两周等）以前
data.enText: the day, week, etc. just before the most recent one; two days, weeks, etc. ago

data.chText: 我已有两个夏天没见过他了。
data.enText: I haven't seen him since the summer before last.
every last…

data.chText: （某群体中的）每一个，全部
data.enText: every person or thing in a group

data.chText: 我们把所有的钱都花在房子上了。
data.enText: We spent every last penny we had on the house.
have the last laugh

data.chText: （在本未指望时）笑在最后，取得最后胜利
data.enText: to be successful when you were not expected to be, making your opponents look stupid
in the last resort

data.chText: 作为最后的一招
data.enText: when there are no other possible courses of action

data.chText: 顶多我们走回家就是了。
data.enText: In the last resort we can always walk home.
your/the last gasp

data.chText: 奄奄一息；苟延残喘；临终；垂死
data.enText: the point at which you/sth can no longer continue living, fighting, existing, etc.
the last minute/moment

data.chText: （重大事情前的）最后一刻，紧要关头
data.enText: the latest possible time before an important event

data.chText: 事到临头他们却改变了计划。
data.enText: They changed the plans at the last minute.

data.chText: 别等到最后一刻才来作决定。
data.enText: Don't leave your decision to the last moment.
a/your last resort

data.chText: 最后可依赖的人（或事物）

data.chText: 其他人我都试过了，现在就靠你了。
data.enText: I've tried everyone else and now you're my last resort.

data.chText: 最新（或时髦、先进等）的事物
data.enText: the most recent, fashionable, advanced, etc. thing

data.chText: 这些房间最为豪华。
data.enText: These apartments are the last word in luxury.

data.chText: 归根结底；总之
data.enText: used to say what is most important after everything has been discussed, or considered

data.chText: 归根结底，这是个人的选择。
data.enText: In the final analysis, it's a matter of personal choice.

data.chText: 最后一口气；临终；临死
data.enText: the last moment of a person's life
famous last words

data.chText: 吹牛，胡扯（表示某人盲目乐观）
data.enText: people sometimes say Famous last words! when they think sb is being too confident about sth that is going to happen

data.chText: “一切都在掌握之中。”“净吹牛！”
data.enText: ‘Everything's under control.’ ‘Famous last words!’

data.chText: 这个短语原指名人临终遗言语录选编。
data.enText: This phrase refers to a collection of quotations of the dying words of famous people.
at long last

data.chText: 最后；终于
data.enText: after a long time

data.chText: 他的祷告终于应验了。
data.enText: At long last his prayers had been answered.
to a man
to the last man

data.chText: 一致；毫无例外
data.enText: used to emphasize that sth is true of all the people being described

data.chText: 他们异口同声地回答：“是。”
data.enText: They answered ‘Yes,’ to a man.

data.chText: 他们无一例外全部被歼。
data.enText: They were all destroyed, to the last man.
the last/final straw
the straw that breaks the camel's back

data.chText: 压垮骆驼的最后一根稻草；终于使人不堪忍受的最后一件事（或因素等）
data.enText: the last in a series of bad events, etc. that makes it impossible for you to accept a situation any longer
first/last thing

data.chText: 一早 / 晚上最后（要做的事）
data.enText: early in the morning/late in the evening

data.chText: 星期一一早这个报告就得放在我的办公桌上。
data.enText: I need the report on my desk first thing Monday morning.
a week yesterday, last Monday, etc.

data.chText: 一个星期前的昨天（或星期一等）
data.enText: seven days before the day that you mention

data.chText: 她在一个星期前的昨天就开始工作了。
data.enText: She started work a week yesterday.
last but not least

data.chText: （提及最后的人或事物时说）最后但同样重要的
data.enText: used when mentioning the last person or thing of a group, in order to say that they are not less important than the others

data.chText: 最后但同样重要的是，我要感谢所有的餐饮工作人员。
data.enText: Last but not least, I'd like to thank all the catering staff.
last in, first out

data.chText: （形容裁员等情况）最后雇用的人最先被解雇，后来者先走
data.enText: used, for example in a situation when people are losing their jobs, to say that the last people to be employed will be the first to go
first and last

data.chText: 从各方面看；完全地
data.enText: in every way that is important; completely

data.chText: 她认为她自己是一个不折不扣的音乐家。
data.enText: She regarded herself, first and last, as a musician.
he who laughs last laughs longest

data.chText: 别高兴得太早
data.enText: used to tell sb not to be too proud of their present success; in the end another person may be more successful
at (long) last

data.chText: （经过长时间的延误或努力等之后）终于，最终
data.enText: after much delay, effort, etc.; in the end

data.chText: 我们终于到家了！
data.enText: At last we're home!

data.chText: 支票终于到了。
data.enText: At long last the cheque arrived.
hear/see the last of sb/sth

data.chText: 最后一次听见（或看见）
data.enText: to hear/see sb/sth for the last time

data.chText: 那是我最后一次见到她。
data.enText: That was the last I ever saw of her.

data.chText: 遗憾的是，我认为这件事还没有了结。
data.enText: Unfortunately, I don't think we've heard the last of this affair.
the last I heard

data.chText: （提供最新消息时说）我听到的最新消息
data.enText: used to give the most recent news you have about sb/sth

data.chText: 我听到的最新消息是他还在汽车修理厂工作。
data.enText: The last I heard he was still working at the garage.
next/second to last
last but one

data.chText: 倒数第二
data.enText: the one before the last one

data.chText: 她得了倒数第二。
data.enText: She finished second to last.
to/till the last

data.chText: 直到最后一刻；（尤指）直至死亡
data.enText: until the last possible moment, especially until death

data.chText: 他至死都坚决辩称自己无罪。
data.enText: He died protesting his innocence to the last.
breathe your last

data.chText: 气绝（身亡）；断气
data.enText: to die
from first to last

data.chText: 从头至尾；自始至终
data.enText: from beginning to end; during the whole time

data.chText: 这是个精彩的演出，自始至终都扣人心弦。
data.enText: It's a fine performance that commands attention from first to last.

tr: a person's dying act
the final thing a person can do
example: he breathed his last

tr: holding device shaped like a human foot that is used to fashion or repair shoes
the concluding parts of an event or occurrence
example: the end was exciting
I had to miss the last of the movie

tr: a unit of capacity for grain equal to 80 bushels
a unit of weight equal to 4,000 pounds
the last or lowest in an ordering or series
example: he was the last to leave
he finished an inglorious last

tr: the time at which life ends
continuing until dead
example: she stayed until his death
a struggle to the last

tr: the temporal end
the concluding time
example: the stopping point of each round was signaled by a bell
the market was up at the finish
they were playing better at the close of the season

tr: continue to live through hardship or adversity
example: We went without water and food for 3 days
These superstitions survive in the backwaters of America
The race car driver lived through several very serious accidents
how long can a person last without food and water?

tr: persist for a specified period of time
example: The bad weather lasted for three days

tr: occurring at the time of death
example: his last words
the last rites

tr: lowest in rank or importance
example: last prize
in last place

tr: not to be altered or undone
example: the judge's decision is final
the arbiter will have the last say

tr: occurring at or forming an end or termination
example: his concluding words came as a surprise
the final chapter
the last days of the dinosaurs
terminal leave

tr: coming after all others in time or space or degree or being the only one remaining
example: the last time I saw Paris
the last day of the month
had the last word
waited until the last minute
he raised his voice in a last supreme call
the last game of the season
down to his last nickel

tr: highest in extent or degree
example: to the last measure of human endurance
whether they were accomplices in the last degree or a lesser one was...to be determined individually

tr: most unlikely or unsuitable
example: the last person we would have suspected
the last man they would have chosen for the job

tr: conclusive in a process or progression
example: the final answer
a last resort
the net result

tr: most_recently
example: I saw him last in London

tr: the item at the end
example: last, I'll discuss family values

value.def: You use last in expressions such as last Friday ,last night, and last year to refer, for example, to the most recent Friday, night, or year.

example.ex: I got married last July...
example.tran: 我在刚过去的7月里结了婚。

example.ex: He never made it home at all last night...
example.tran: 他昨晚根本没回家。

example.ex: Last month a shopkeeper's nephew was shot dead...
example.tran: 上个月一名店主的侄子被枪杀了。

example.ex: It is not surprising they did so badly in last year's elections.
example.tran: 他们在去年选举中如此糟糕的表现并不奇怪。

value.tran: （表示最近过去的）刚过去的星期五/昨晚/去年

value.def: The last event, person, thing, or period of time is the most recent one.

example.ex: Much has changed since my last visit...
example.tran: 从我上次去到现在，很多事情已经变了。

example.ex: At the last count inflation was 10.9 per cent...
example.tran: 最近一次统计显示通胀率为10.9%。

example.ex: I split up with my last boyfriend three years ago...
example.tran: 我3年前和前任男友分的手。

example.ex: The last few weeks have been hectic.
example.tran: 过去几周一直忙得不可开交。

example.ex: The next tide, it was announced, would be even higher than the last.
example.tran: 据报下一次潮水甚至会比上一次涨得更高。

value.def: If something last happened on a particular occasion, that is the most recent occasion on which it happened.

example.ex: When were you there last?...
example.tran: 你上次去是什么时候？

example.ex: The house is a little more dilapidated than when I last saw it...
example.tran: 那房子比我上次见到时更破旧了些。

example.ex: Hunting on the trust's 625,000 acres was last debated two years ago.
example.tran: 有关在该托管机构管理的62.5万英亩土地上狩猎一事，最近一次辩论是两年前。

value.def: The last thing, person, event, or period of time is the one that happens or comes after all the others of the same kind.

example.ex: This is his last chance as prime minister.
example.tran: 这是他作为首相的最后机会。

example.ex: ...the last three pages of the chapter...
example.tran: 该章最后3页

example.ex: She said it was the very last house on the road...
example.tran: 她说就是路边最后那间屋子。

example.ex: They didn't come last in their league.
example.tran: 他们没有在联赛中垫底。

example.ex: It wasn't  the first time that this particular difference had divided them and it wouldn't be the last...
example.tran: 他们因此事产生分歧不是第一次，也不会是最后一次。

example.ex: The trickiest bits are the last on the list.
example.tran: 最棘手的部分列在最后。

value.def: If you do something last, you do it after everyone else does, or after you do everything else.

example.ex: I testified last...
example.tran: 我最后一个作证。

example.ex: I was always picked last for the football team at school...
example.tran: 在学校里分队踢足球时，我总是最后被挑的那一个。

example.ex: The foreground, nearest the viewer, is painted last.
example.tran: 距离观者最近的前景是最后才画的。

value.def: If you are the last to do or know something, everyone else does or knows it before you.

example.ex: She was the last to go to bed...
example.tran: 她最后一个上床。

example.ex: Riccardo and I are always the last to know what's going on.
example.tran: 我和里卡尔多总是最后才知道发生什么事情。

value.def: Last is used to refer to the only thing, person, or part of something that remains.

example.ex: Jed nodded, finishing off the last piece of pizza.
example.tran: 杰德点点头，把最后一块比萨饼吃完。

example.ex: ...the freeing of the last hostage.
example.tran: 最后一名人质的获释

example.ex: He finished off the last of the wine...
example.tran: 他喝完了最后一点酒。

example.ex: The last of the ten inmates gave themselves up after twenty eight hours on the roof of the prison.
example.tran: 在监狱屋顶上坚持了28小时后，10名囚犯中的最后几个终于投降。

value.def: You use last before numbers to refer to a position that someone has reached in a competition after other competitors have been knocked out.

example.ex: Sampras reached the last four at Wimbledon.
example.tran: 桑普拉斯杀入了温布尔登四强。

example.ex: ...the only woman among the authors making it through to the last six.
example.tran: 进入最后6人名单的唯一一位女作家

value.tran: （竞赛中）最后留下的，排位在前的

value.def: You can use last to indicate that something is extremely undesirable or unlikely.

example.ex: The last thing I wanted to do was teach...
example.tran: 我最不想干的事情就是教书。

example.ex: He would be the last person who would do such a thing.
example.tran: 他最不可能干这种事情。

example.ex: I would be the last to say that science has explained everything.
example.tran: 我绝对不认为科学已经解释了所有事情。

value.tran: 最不想要的；最不可能的

value.def: The last you see of someone or the last you hear of them is the final time that you see them or talk to them.

example.ex: She disappeared shouting, 'To the river, to the river!' And that was the last we saw of her...
example.tran: 她高喊着“往河里去，往河里去！”然后就消失了。那是我们最后一次看到她的情形。

example.ex: I had a feeling it would be the last I heard of him.
example.tran: 我有一种感觉，这将是我最后一次听到他的消息。

value.def: If an event, situation, or problem lasts for a particular length of time, it continues to exist or happen for that length of time.

example.ex: The marriage had lasted for less than two years...
example.tran: 这段婚姻维持了不到两年。

example.ex: The games lasted only half the normal time...
example.tran: 比赛只持续了通常时间的一半。

example.ex: Enjoy it because it won't last.
example.tran: 尽情享受吧，因为这不会长久。

value.tran: 持续，延续，维持（一段时间）

value.def: If something lasts for a particular length of time, it continues to be able to be used for that time, for example because there is some of it left or because it is in good enough condition.

example.ex: You only need a very small blob of glue, so one tube lasts for ages...
example.tran: 每次只需一点点胶水而已，因此一管可以用很长时间。

example.ex: The repaired sail lasted less than 24 hours...
example.tran: 修好的帆支撑了不到24小时。

example.ex: The implication is that this battery lasts twice as long as other batteries...
example.tran: 言外之意是，这种电池的寿命是其他品牌电池的两倍。

example.ex: If you build more plastics into cars, the car lasts longer.
example.tran: 如果汽车采用更多塑料元件，寿命会更长一些。

value.tran: 够用，保持可用状态（一段时间）

value.def: You can use last in expressions such as last the game ,last the course, and last the week, to indicate that someone manages to take part in an event or situation right to the end, especially when this is very difficult for them.

example.ex: They wouldn't  have lasted the full game...
example.tran: 他们本不可能撑完整场比赛的。

example.ex: I almost lasted the two weeks. I only had a couple of days to do.
example.tran: 我几乎撑过了这两个星期。我只有几天时间去做。

posc.def: To last out means the same as to last.

example.ex: It'll be a miracle if the band lasts out the tour...
example.tran: 如果乐队能撑完巡演，那将是个奇迹。

example.ex: A breakfast will be served to those who last out till dawn!
example.tran: 坚持到天亮的能吃上早餐！

value.boxu_tran: 注意，谈论很长一段时间之后最终发生的事，不用after all，而用at last，finally，in the end，lastly或last of all。表示经历了长久的等待或期待时，用at last或finally，at last通常置于句末，例如，The storm that had threatened came at last（酝酿已久的暴风雨终于来了）。finally则通常置于句首或动词之前：After another search they finally located the house（又搜寻了一番后，他们终于找到了那幢房子）。finally亦用于谈论一连串事情的最后一件：He lived in Turkey, France, Norway, and finally Mexico（他曾在土耳其、法国和挪威生活过，最后来到了墨西哥）。表示某事经历了较长的时间或过程后发生，则用 in the end, 例如，Perhaps the police got him in the end（也许警方最终抓到了他），In the end, Peter seemed quite happy（最后，彼得似乎很开心）。lastly用于谈论一连串人或事物的最后一个或一件：I went through the bathroom, the bedroom, and lastly the sitting room（浴室、卧室最后连客厅我都找遍了）。last of all 则用来强调在提到的人或事物之后再无他人或其他事物，例如，Last of all came the cat（最后出场的是猫）。
value.boxu_usage: Note that you do not use after all if you want to talk about what happens at the end of a long period, instead you use at last, finally, in the end, lastly, or last of all. You use at last or finally when you have been waiting for or expecting something for a long time. At last usually comes at the end of a sentence. The storm that had threatened came at last. Finally usually comes at the beginning of a sentence or before a verb. After another search they finally located the house. You also use finally to talk about something that is the last in a series of things. He lived in Turkey, France, Norway, and finally Mexico. You use in the end when talking about something that happens after a long time or a long process. Perhaps the police got him in the end... In the end, Peter seemed quite happy. You use lastly to talk about the last of a series of people or things. I went through the bathroom, the bedroom, and lastly the sitting room. You use last of all to emphasize that there is nobody or nothing else after the person or thing you mention. Last of all came the cat.

value.def: If you say that something has happened at last or at long last you mean it has happened after you have been hoping for it for a long time.

example.ex: I'm  so glad that we've found you at last!...
example.tran: 我们终于找到你了，我真是太高兴了！

example.ex: Here, at long last, was the moment he had waited for...
example.tran: 他等待已久的时刻终于到来。

example.ex: At last the train arrived in the station...
example.tran: 火车终于到站了。

example.ex: 'All right', he said at last. 'You may go.'
example.tran: “好吧”，他终于开口道，“你可以走了。”

value.def: You use expressions such as the night before last ,the election before last and the leader before last to refer to the period of time, event, or person that came immediately before the most recent one in a series.

example.ex: It was the dog he'd heard the night before last...
example.tran: 他前晚听到的是狗叫声。

example.ex: In the budget before last a tax penalty on the mobile phone was introduced.
example.tran: 上上次的预算案中对移动电话引入了惩罚性税收。

value.tran: 前天晚上／ 上上次选举／上上任领导人

value.def: If someone breathes their last, they die.

You can use phrases such as the last but one, the last but two, or the last but three, to refer to the thing or person that is, for example, one, two, or three before the final person or thing in a group or series.

example.ex: It's the last but one day in the athletics programme...
example.tran: 那是田径比赛结束的前一天。

example.ex: The British team finished last but one.
example.tran: 英国队位列倒数第二。

value.tran: 倒数第二／倒数第三／ 倒数第四

value.def: You use every last to emphasize that you are talking about all the people or things in a group or all the parts of something.

example.ex: I'd spent all I had, every last penny...
example.tran: 我把钱全部花光了，一分不剩。

example.ex: You'll never quite get rid of every last bit of grit...
example.tran: 无法把所有的沙砾都清除干净。

example.ex: My tape recorder did not catch every last word.
example.tran: 我的录音机并没有把每一个字都录下来。

value.def: The expression last in, first out is used to say that the last person who started work in an organization should be the first person to leave it, if fewer people are needed.

example.ex: Workers will go on a 'last in, first out' basis.
example.tran: 对工人的裁员原则是“后进先出”。

value.tran: （需要裁员时首先解雇新员工的）“后进先出”原则

value.def: You can use expressions such as the last I heard and the last she heard to introduce a piece of information that is the most recent that you have on a particular subject.

example.ex: The last I heard, Joe and Irene were still happily married.
example.tran: 我最近一次听说时，乔和艾琳仍然是一对快乐的夫妻。

value.tran: 我/她最近一次听到有关…的消息；最新消息

value.def: If you leave something or someone until last, you delay using, choosing, or dealing with them until you have used, chosen, or dealt with all the others.

example.ex: I have left my best wine until last...
example.tran: 我把最好的酒留到了最后。

example.ex: I picked first all the people who usually were left till last.
example.tran: 我先挑出了所有通常留到最后的人。

value.def: If you see the last of someone, you do not expect to see them or deal with them again.

example.ex: I honestly thought I'd seen the last of you.
example.tran: 老实说我以为再也不用见到你了。

value.def: If you say that something goes on happening to the last, you mean that it happens throughout the whole of a book, film, or event.

example.ex: ...a highly readable political thriller with plenty of twists of plot to keep you guessing to the last.
example.tran: 一部可读性极强的政治惊悚小说，情节峰回路转，不到最后一刻绝对猜不中结局

value.tran: 贯穿（全书、整部电影或整件事情）

value.def: If you say that someone is a particular kind of person to the last, you are emphasizing that they continue to be that kind of person.

example.ex: A gentleman to the last, he did not run, but merely attempted to stroll away...
example.tran: 他始终保持绅士风度，没有拔脚就跑，只是试图移步走开。

example.ex: Armstrong was tall and handsome to the last.
example.tran: 阿姆斯特朗从来都是这么高大、英俊。

value.def: You use expressions such as to the last detail and to the last man to indicate that a plan, situation, or activity includes every single person, thing, or part involved.

example.ex: Every movement, no matter how casual and spontaneous, needs to be worked out to the last detail...
example.tran: 对每一个动作，无论它显得多么随意和无意识，都不能放过一丝细节。

example.ex: Our troops are being used up to the last man.
example.tran: 我们的部队已人尽其用。

value.tran: （表示全部包括在内）任何一丝细节/ 每一个人

trans: 去年；上年；那个俱乐部去年解散了
上月(例: He came here last month. 他是上月来这里的)
最后一分钟订房；最后一刻；最后；最后一分钟；最后时刻
上周六；上个星期六；上星期六；过去时；上周星期六
最后不能不提；最后但同样重要的是
